channel.title: What now?
channel.description: I have a loader that half works, it downloads the rs jar and opens up a new frame yet it doesnt load the actual client, I was just wondering what do I do now?

item.title: What now?
item.dc:creator: @qauters qauters
item.description:
@qauters wrote:

[quote=“frank_, post:21, topic:212941”][quote author=unlimitedorb link=topic=280393.msg2284264#msg2284264 date=1213839916]
Who said that you have to spoof the entire session? Loading the modified client would suffice. After that, you can hand over all requests to the legitimate server.
[/quote]
pretty sure the web page is loaded before the applet[/quote]
True, first the site, then the applet, then the pictures. Because the applet is created through javascript.

Read full topic

item.title: What now?
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

unlimitedorb:

Who said that you have to spoof the entire session? Loading the modified client would suffice. After that, you can hand over all requests to the legitimate server.

pretty sure the web page is loaded before the applet

Read full topic

item.title: What now?
item.dc:creator: @qauters qauters
item.description:
@qauters wrote:

Not to mention the fact, why the hell would I want to load a modified client in the web browser.
It kinda spoils the idea, of remaining undetectable. If you inject into the web browser, to get an instance of the loaded applets, you have full control without having the possibility of being detected. Which means I can make an undetectable bot, as long as mouse movement etc aren’t to stupid.
Which makes it as safe (or safer) then a color clicker, which some people seem to love so much. (Scar / Nexus)
The only thing you need to make, is a failsafe updater.

Read full topic

item.title: What now?
item.dc:creator: @unlimitedorb unlimitedorb
item.description:
@unlimitedorb wrote:

[quote=“frank_, post:16, topic:212941”][quote author=unlimitedorb link=topic=280393.msg2284233#msg2284233 date=1213838669]
snip
trick your web browser into loading a modified client through use of ARP cache poisoning, etc making it appear to the web browser as if it’s requesting resources from a legitimate server.
snip
[/quote]
not only will it download the modified client from that domain, it will have required that domain to load the page from… and then attempt to connect to that domain for the game server

before you go off making rash accusations, realise the full implications of your ideas[/quote]

Actually, you’re wrong.

Too bad you decided to leave that witty comment at the end about me not realizing the full implications of my ideas otherwise you’d be right, but only because I didn’t feel like elaborating.

Who said that you have to spoof the entire session? Loading the modified client would suffice. After that, you can hand over all requests to the legitimate server.[br][br][quote=“io9, post:17, topic:212941”]You’re all fuckwits, except for frank_ and yakman…[/quote]

There’s one in every community…

Read full topic

item.title: What now?
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

[quote=“unlimitedorb, post:15, topic:212941”][quote author=yakman link=topic=280393.msg2284085#msg2284085 date=1213834580]

Get the RSApplet class…
[/quote]And use the reflection API (java.lang.reflect) to load that class.

Inject in a web browser, to load that class through JNI.

Why not spoof DNS instead?

you obviously have no idea what you’re talking about, so shut the fuck up,

Actually, you’re wrong.

How about you learn what DNS spoofing is before you make idiotic comments. The only thing that’s obvious right now is that you don’t understand the full implications of it because, if you did (which you don’t), you would know that it’s possible to trick your web browser into loading a modified client through use of ARP cache poisoning, etc making it appear to the web browser as if it’s requesting resources from a legitimate server.

Don’t think I don’t remember why you’re so quick to flame me right now… I’ll let this oversight slide, but only because I know how easy it is to make stupid comments if you’re trying to pay someone back.[/quote]

why would you “trick” your browser?
you just download the firefox source and hack it to do what you want,
or use a javaagent,

your browser is something you control, you have no need to trick it,

your idea sucks anyway, DNS spoofing is seriously impractical for this, no way you would make a proper bot using it,
if you want to go to from New York to Washington via Berlin, then be my guest,

Read full topic

item.title: What now?
item.dc:creator: @unlimitedorb unlimitedorb
item.description:
@unlimitedorb wrote:

[quote=“yakman, post:14, topic:212941”][quote author=unlimitedorb link=topic=280393.msg2284074#msg2284074 date=1213834072]

Get the RSApplet class…
[/quote]And use the reflection API (java.lang.reflect) to load that class.

Inject in a web browser, to load that class through JNI.

Why not spoof DNS instead?

you obviously have no idea what you’re talking about, so shut the fuck up,[/quote]

Actually, you’re wrong.

How about you learn what DNS spoofing is before you make idiotic comments. The only thing that’s obvious right now is that you don’t understand the full implications of it because, if you did (which you don’t), you would know that it’s possible to trick your web browser into loading a modified client through use of ARP cache poisoning, etc making it appear to the web browser as if it’s requesting resources from a legitimate server.

Don’t think I don’t remember why you’re so quick to flame me right now… I’ll let this oversight slide, but only because I know how easy it is to make stupid comments if you’re trying to pay someone back.

Read full topic

item.title: What now?
item.dc:creator: @BAsh BAsh
item.description:
@BAsh wrote:

I think bcel includes one but I would avoid the whole repository thing. I don’t really recall why I avoided it but I think it was something to do with lack of features with the repository itself. For example you couldn’t remove or replace classes(in bytecode).

Its simpler to use your own anyway. Just subclass ClassLoader and call defineClass.

Read full topic

item.title: What now?
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

you cant use bcel/asm/* as classloaders

Read full topic

item.title: What now?
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

[quote=“io9, post:8, topic:212941”][quote author=TeleNubby link=topic=280393.msg2280928#msg2280928 date=1213682557]

Get the RSApplet class…
[/quote]And use the reflection API (java.lang.reflect) to load that class.

Errm no?

Just get a URLClassLoader to lad from the JAR, then call loader.loadClass(“loader”); Cast it to applet then do applet.init()/applet.sdtart() as Ollie said.

Speaking of which, Ollie halped me a lot w/ my first loader etc. (<333)[/quote]Ugh. I have no idea what I was thinking at the time. I was mixed up with a whole bunch of things, and just happened to mention reflection (I probably thought ClassLoader was in that package instead, etc.) Whatever.

You could also use BCEL/ASM/other to load the class. And if you really want to get fancy, instead of using URLClassLoader, you have the option of getting the main class data yourself either using that bytecode library (I dont quite remember if BCEL has an option to get a new Class instance from one of their own), or other methods such as reading the input stream and then using ClassLoader.defineClass() to create that Class instance. And then of course, proceed with Ollie’s method.

Read full topic

item.title: What now?
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

[quote=“TeleNubby, post:5, topic:212941”][quote author=io9 link=topic=280393.msg2280915#msg2280915 date=1213682052]
Get the RSApplet class…
[/quote]And use the reflection API (java.lang.reflect) to load that class.[/quote]
Errm no?

Just get a URLClassLoader to lad from the JAR, then call loader.loadClass(“loader”); Cast it to applet then do applet.init()/applet.sdtart() as Ollie said.

Speaking of which, Ollie halped me a lot w/ my first loader etc. (<333)

Read full topic

item.title: What now?
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

Applet applet = (Applet) theLoaderClassInstance.newInstance();
applet.init()
applet.start()
